Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District -- Local Option - Term Limits
Race.FullText:
"LOCAL OPTION ELECTION
Within St. Tammany Parish School District:
Shall the number of terms of office that any member of the school board may serve be limited to three consecutive four-year terms?"

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Parish Council -- 1.84 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Health Unit Tax Renewal)

Summary:  10 year, 1.84 mills property tax renewal for supporting the St. Tammany Parish Health Center and related public health activities, including the construction of new buildings and/or renovation of existing health unit buildings.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), continue to levy a one and eighty-four hundredths (1.84) mills tax on all the property subject to taxation in said Parish (an estimated $2,910,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2023, for the purpose of supporting the St. Tammany Parish Health Center and related public health activities, including the construction of new buildings and/or renovation of existing health unit buildings?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Covington -- 1% S&U Tax - CC
Race.SummaryText:
City of Covington Proposition
(Sales Tax Rededication)

Summary:  Authority to rededicate the proceeds of a 1% sales and use tax authorized at elections held on October 29, 1957 and July 21, 2001, for various purposes.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Covington, State of Louisiana (the "City") be authorized to rededicate all of the proceeds received by the City from the levy and collection of a 1% sales and use tax authorized at an election held on October 29, 1957, as amended at an election held on July 21, 2001 (an estimated $3,750,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) so that such proceeds (after paying the reasonable and necessary costs and expenses of collecting and administering the tax) may be used for any lawful corporate purpose of the City, including, but not limited to, funding into bonds as authorized at the election held on July 21, 2001, constructing, improving, extending, maintaining and/or operating: playgrounds and recreational facilities, public roads, streets, bridges and crossings, sewerage, garbage disposal, water works, public safety operations and facilities and other public improvements and facilities in the City, title to which shall be in the public?

Race.SpecificTitle: Waterworks District No. 2 -- $985,000 Bonds - BOC - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Waterworks District No. 2 Proposition
(Bond)

Summary:  Authority to issue not exceeding $985,000 of not exceeding 20 year General Obligation Bonds of Waterworks District No. 2 for the purpose of constructing and acquiring extensions and improvements to the waterworks system of the District, including furnishings, equipment and machinery therefor.
Race.FullText: Shall Waterworks District No. 2 of the Parish of St. Tammany, State of Louisiana (the "District"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of not exceeding Nine Hundred Eighty-Five Thousand Dollars ($985,000) to run not exceeding twenty (20) years from the date thereof, with interest at a rate or rates not exceeding seven per centum (7%) per annum, for the purpose of constructing and acquiring extensions and improvements to the waterworks system of the District, including fixtures, equipment and machinery therefor, title to which shall be in the public, which bonds will be general obligations of the District and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, and statutory authority supplemental thereto, with no estimated increase in the millage rate to be levied in the first year of issue above the 6 mills currently being levied to pay General Obligation Bonds of the District?
